value.title: DAX Fridays #191: Create a last invoice calculation: the process, calculation and troubleshooting
value.excerpt: So, how do you need to think when creating a DAX measures? Do you create the measure in one step? Do you break it down in small steps? How do you troubleshoot it?  In today's video I am going to show you the steps you need to take to create a DAX measure and troubleshoot it. The measure is : last invoice

value.title: DAX Fridays! #194: COVID Tracker Part2: Modeling and getting the last value of an accumulated list
value.excerpt: In part 2 of the creation of the covid vaccine tracker, we are going to model the data we imported in part 1 (see link below) and create the most difficult calculation: The sum of the values from the last date that is not blank. value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.excerpt: Have you ever got this error message?: A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected ?
